TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . According to an affidavit sworn by the applicant before ORG on DATE , the demonstration of DATE was peaceful and was held on DATE of the NORP intervention in GPE in support of the missing persons and to protest against human rights violations .

CARDINAL . The demonstrators gathered at the ORG school in GPE . After ORG ( ORG ) soldiers had shouted a warning to the demonstrators not to advance further , the applicant was seized by the hair , beaten and assaulted by NORP military personnel and/or other personnel acting under NORP control . The beating was inflicted with electrical batons by QUANTITY or CARDINAL policemen all over the applicant ’s body , in particular the head and back . CARDINAL of the blows caused a painful injury to the applicant ’s right arm and elbow , with loss of blood . She was then dragged to a small , stiflingly hot room in which other demonstrators were also being held . CARDINAL of the prisoners had been severely beaten and was unconscious .

As she entered the garage her handbag was seized . She was forced to sit on the floor ; the toilet facilities were filthy . The interrogation took place in NORP and touched mainly on political subjects . DATE , DATE , she and the other detainees were given food and at the same time photographed and filmed by a television crew .

CARDINAL . As a result of the beating described above , CARDINAL of the applicant ’s vertebrae were damaged . The doctors told her that the condition of her central nerve was continuously deteriorating and that no surgery could be carried out .

CARDINAL . The Government alleged that the applicant had participated in a violent demonstration with the aim of enflaming anti - NORP sentiment . The demonstrators , supported by the NORP - Cypriot administration , were demanding that the “ GPE ” in GPE should be dismantled . Some carried NORP flags , clubs , knives and wire - cutters . They were acting in a provocative manner and shouting abuse . The demonstrators were warned in NORP and LANGUAGE that unless they dispersed they would be arrested in accordance with the laws of the “ GPE ” . The applicant was arrested by the NORP - NORP police after crossing the ORG buffer zone and entering the area under NORP - Cypriot control . The NORP - NORP police intervened in the face of the manifest inability of the NORP - Cypriot authorities and ORG in GPE to contain the incursion and its possible consequences .

CARDINAL . No force was used against demonstrators who did not intrude into the “ GPE ” border area and , in the case of demonstrators who were arrested for violating the border , no more force was used than was reasonably necessary in the circumstances in order to arrest and detain the persons concerned . No one was ill - treated . It was possible that some of the demonstrators had hurt themselves in the confusion or in attempting to scale barbed wire or other fencing . Had the NORP police , or anyone else , assaulted or beaten any of the demonstrators , the ORG Secretary General would no doubt have referred to this in his report to ORG .

CARDINAL . The applicant was charged , tried , found guilty and sentenced to a short term of imprisonment . She pleaded not guilty , but did not give evidence and declined to use the available judicial remedies . She was asked if she required assistance from a lawyer registered in the “ GPE ” , but refused and did not ask for legal representation . Interpretation services were provided at the trial by qualified interpreters . All the proceedings were translated into NORP .

CARDINAL . The judgment was given in the presence of the accused and of an interpreter . The trial judge noted the following :
( i ) the accused did not accept the charges against them and stated that they did not wish to use the services of a lawyer registered in the “ GPE ” ;
( ii ) some of the accused had fainted during the trial and had been taken to hospital and excused from attending the hearing ;
( iii ) the public prosecutor called CARDINAL witnesses , whose statements were translated into NORP for the accused ’s benefit ;

( iv ) the witnesses ( mainly police officers on duty at the time of the demonstration ) declared that the accused had illegally entered the “ GPE ” buffer zone , shouted abuse at the NORP - Cypriot forces , resisted arrest by pulling and pushing ; knives and other cutting objects had been found in the bags of some of the demonstrators who had been arrested ; in particular , the witnesses declared that the demonstrators had passed the barriers at the ORG observation post , broken the wooden door of a church and moved toward a water reservoir ; according to a map shown at trial , the area where the accused had entered was “ TRNC ” territory ;
( v ) the accused did not call any defence witnesses and did not address the court ;

( vi ) the accused had been told that they could cross - examine witnesses in turn and , if they so wished , choose one of their number to cross - examine the witnesses on behalf of all the accused ; however , they had not done so ;

( vii ) relying on the statements of the prosecution witnesses , ORG came to the conclusion that the accused had crossed the borders of the “ TRNC ” at an unapproved entry point and without permission and had resisted by various means the ORG and NORP forces which had tried to stop them ;
( viii ) the prosecution had proved its case beyond reasonable doubt , so that the accused were guilty on both counts ;
( ix ) in deciding on the sentence , ORG took into account the seriousness of the offence , and the fact that the accused had shown no remorse and continued to deny the validity of the “ TRNC ” .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of LAW reads as follows :

“ Where CARDINAL or more persons assembled with intent to commit an offence , or , being assembled with intent to carry out some common purpose , conduct themselves in such a manner as to cause persons in the neighbourhood to fear that the persons so assembled will commit a breach of the peace , or will by such assembly needlessly and without any reasonable occasion provoke other persons to commit a breach of the peace they are an unlawful assembly .
It is immaterial that the original assembling was lawful if , being assembled , they conduct themselves with a common purpose in such a manner as aforesaid .

When an unlawful assembly has begun to execute the purpose , whether of a public or of a private nature , for which it assembled by a breach of the peace and to the terror of the public , the assembly is called a riot , and the persons assembled are said to be riotously assembled . ”
CARDINAL . According to section CARDINAL of LAW , any person who takes part in an unlawful assembly is guilty of a misdemeanour and liable to imprisonment for DATE .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the Criminal Code provides :

“ Any person who carries in public without lawful occasion any offensive arm or weapon in such a manner as to cause terror to any person is guilty of a misdemeanour , and is liable to imprisonment for DATE , and his arm or weapons shall be forfeited . ”
